And the other is that the other flaw remained: (Confusion), and I strove to find what removes it, like the narration of Sufyan and Shu'bah and their likes, from those who narrated from him before the confusion, but I have not succeeded until now, therefore when I extracted the hadith in "Takhrij Fiqh al-Seerah" (p. 251 and 260 - Dar al-Qalam), then in "Sahih Abi Dawud" (2390); I strengthened the hadith with some witnesses, from the hadith of Ibn Abbas authenticated by Al-Hakim and Al-Dhahabi, and Al-Hafiz remained silent about it in "Al-Fath", and from the hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, and its men are trustworthy. So (Al-Haddam) should have strengthened this hadith with such witnesses! If authentication concerned him! 150 - "The statement of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to the one who said to him: What Allah wills and you will -: 'Have you made me a rival to Allah?!'": The author asserted it, and it is the truth. And (Al-Haddam) opposed him so he weakened it, and attributed it to a group; among them Al-Bukhari in "Al-Adab Al-Mufrad" (787), then said: "And Al-Ajlah has weakness in him, and he has denounced reports." Thus he said! And it is a strong witness to his obstinacy and opposing the Imams with falsehood, for I have mentioned more than once that the narrator having: "weakness in him" does not make his hadith weak, but rather it is Hasan at least, which is what I ruled in "Al-Sahihah" (1/56 - 57 - First Edition), so he opposed me - as is his habit - with this saying of his, which is a proof against him; otherwise what is the difference for him between Sahih and Hasan?!

text: Therefore Al-Dhahabi said in "Al-Mughni": "There is no harm in his hadith." And he said in "Narrators spoken of with criticism that does not warrant rejection" (p. 58/13): "Truthful, narrated from Al-Sha'bi, Ibn Ma'in and others authenticated him, and Al-Nasa'i said: Weak." Likewise Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Taqrib": "Truthful." Therefore he remained silent about the hadith in "Al-Fath" (11/540) indicating its strengthening, and his sheikh Al-Hafiz Al-Iraqi graded it Hasan in "Takhrij Al-Ihya" (3/162). So this is the stance of the scholars regarding the hadith and its narrator regarding strengthening, so what is the value of (Al-Haddam's) weakening of them; except confirming his following {other than the path of the believers}! And before moving to another; I want to draw attention that his extraction of the hadith is a theft from "Al-Sahihah", evidenced by the fact that the number of his attribution to Al-Bukhari in "Al-Adab Al-Mufrad" occurred as an error: (787); so he transferred it exactly as you saw! And its correct [number] is (773)!! And it has other examples, some of which were mentioned in another place! 151 - "The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: 'It was said to the Children of Israel: {And enter the gate prostrating and say, "Relieve us," and We will forgive you your sins.}, but they changed, so they entered the gate returning on their buttocks, and they said: A grain in a hair, so they changed the saying and deed together, so Allah sent down upon them a torment from the sky'": (Al-Haddam) the Ignorant said: "Extracted by Al-Bukhari (3403), (4479) and (4641), and Muslim (3015)". I say: (Al-Haddam) erred against them - and against the author - a gross error, due to his ignorance of the Sunnah, and his lack of care for memorizing its texts, for his saying: "So they changed the saying..." is not the completion of the hadith with them, nor with others, so he made it part of the completion of the hadith by placing it between double quotation marks at its beginning and end! - as you see above -, and I only

He said: 'They forbade the lawful for them, and permitted the unlawful, so they obeyed them, so that was their worship of them'; narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and others": The author asserted it, and it is the truth. And (Al-Haddam) weakened it by saying (2/375): "And this chain is weak, Ghutayf bin A'yan is weak, and there is obscurity (Jahalah) in him"! I say: He combined contradictions in describing the narrator with weakness and obscurity! Because describing him with weakness means he is known for weakness in narration, and describing him with obscurity means he is not known for that!! This combination - alone - informs the researcher that he is an intruder in this science - this is from one aspect -. The other: What Al-Hafiz reported in "Al-Tahdhib" from Al-Daraqutni that he weakened this (Ghutayf), which is pure illusion against Al-Daraqutni; for he only weakened (Ruh bin Ghutayf) in the hadith of (The Dirham); this confused with that for some of the narrators spoken of, so Al-Daraqutni alerted in his two books "Al-Ilal", and "Al-Sunan" - to his illusion regarding it, and explicitly stated that the narrator of this hadith is only "Ruh", and that he is weak, so Al-Hafiz thought he was (Ghutayf)! I have placed this investigation in "Al-Silsilah Al-Sahihah" under number (3293), and I mentioned for the hadith therein some witnesses that strengthen it, and (Al-Haddam) concealed them - and I do not say: he was ignorant of them -, because one of them was in front of him in a source from the sources to which he attributed the hadith!! 153 - "And the Muslims await the descent of the Messiah Jesus son of Mary from the sky, and his breaking of the cross... and the emergence of the Mahdi from the family of the Prophethood, filling the earth with justice as it was filled with oppression": I say: It is as he said (may Allah have mercy on him), and it is a creed received by the Successors from the Predecessors, supported by dozens of authentic hadiths in the "Two Sahihs" - and others from the "Sunan" and "Mu'jams" -, yet (Al-Haddam) left it blank, and did not extract anything from them, and most likely he does not believe in them, and casts doubt on their authenticity, following some people of desires old and new! Otherwise; why does he pass over this speech of the author, and not extract even a single hadith

For - as you see - he placed note (1) on the word (Adar); so is this the extent of attribution to the Two Sheikhs?! And he attributed note (2) to the word (Lindaban), so is this portion of it not authentic?! Because he flawed it with the obscurity of Al-Tabari's sheikh! I believe - based on my certain knowledge of his crooked ways in weakening authentic hadiths - that the man does not believe in this hadith because of the miracle of the Stone contained in it, therefore he made it difficult for the readers to know the authenticity of the hadith, with confusing them by attributing it to the Two Sheikhs!! The truth is that the hadith is authentic in its entirety up to his saying: The Verse, and Al-Bukhari's context is more complete, and I extracted it in "Al-Sahihah" (3075); and Muslim has two contexts for it, one more complete than the other, which (Al-Haddam) did not find: for the number he attributed it to is in (Purification)! And I fear that this was intentional from him to attribute it to Al-Tabari, so he weakens its authenticity by his saying regarding Al-Tabari's sheikh: "Bahr bin Habib; I did not see a biography for him"; while the correct name is (Yahya bin Habib); thus Muslim narrated it from him in "Al-Fada'il" (7/99); so did he conceal this, and show the distorted one to weaken it?! Otherwise he is ignorant for the distortion passing on him - firstly -, and for his attributing what is in the Two Sheikhs to Al-Tabari - secondly -; for Al-Bukhari (3404) also narrated it from another sheikh following Yahya bin Habib. As for the hadith of Ibn Sirin, it is the one whose authenticity was previously explained from the narration of Muslim and Al-Tabari from the narration of Yahya bin Habib. So reflect on how much confusion and misleading is in the extraction of this (Destroyer) - despite its small size -?! 156 - "And Abu Dawud narrated in his 'Sunan' from Ibn Umar, he said: A group of Jews came, and invited the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to Al-Quff (1), so he came to them in the house of schools (Bayt al-Madaris) (2), and they said: O Abu Al-Qasim! I say: This hadith has no origin with this wording mentioned by the author (may Allah have mercy on him), yet (Al-Haddam) started his extraction with what gives no benefit to the readers from his mention of Al-Zamakhshari, Al-Ajluni, and Al-Hakim! For even if they extracted the hadith or provided a chain for it, that would not benefit anything except by clarifying the condition of its chain, so how about when they suspended it, and did not mention a chain for it?! And if Al-Hakim had provided a chain and authenticated it even with a Hasan chain, he would have hastened to refute him and preface it with his saying: "Its chain is weak" - as is his habit! - So what happened - here - that he departed from his habit, and obscured for the readers the reality of this hadith, and that it has no origin?! Nothing but quarrelsomeness and opposition which he kneaded himself with, and proceeded upon - as you saw in what preceded in all his extractions -; for he saw me prefacing the hadith with my saying: "It has no origin with this wording", in "Silsilat al-Ahadith al-Da'ifah" number (331), then I extracted it in detail in two pages from the narration of Al-Hakim suspended with this wording, and connected from the hadith of Mu'awiyah with the flimsy wording, and from my mentioned extraction; (Al-Haddam) presented the summary mentioned above! And it is a dark summary with no light in it, for it was obligatory on him to state explicitly that the mentioned wording has no origin - as I did -, but the love of quarrelsomeness and opposition prevented him from that, and appearing in the guise of the independent researcher who does not imitate (!), while in reality he does not even do well as a (blind follower) of the people of knowledge! Due to his vanity and arrogance!! We ask Allah for safety.
